inclusion.criterion: asthma diagnosis according to GINA guidelines
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: severe asthma defined by uncontrolled symptoms or FEV1 <80%
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Spirometry revealed a forced expiratory volume in the first second (FEV1) of 60% of the predicted

inclusion.criterion: diagnosis of asthma according to one or more criteria
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: improvement in FEV1 ≥ 12% and 200ml predicted after inhalation of 400 mcg salbutamol ( Spirometry revealed a forced expiratory volume in the first second (FEV1) of 60% of the predicted )

inclusion.criterion: history of wheeze occurring spontaneously or on exertion
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient presents with shortness of breath, chest tightening and cough.

exclusion.criterion: significant alternative diagnoses that may mimic or complicate asthma
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: His past medical history is non-significant.

notes: The patient has a history of wheezing and shortness of breath, but no significant past medical history. He requires general corticosteroid therapy for his asthma exacerbation.
